I pledge to continue working with my colleagues on both sides of the aisle on the critical issues that matter to the people of Indianapolis. Our country state and city are facing unprecedented challenges and we must come together in order to overcome them.

It’s an honor to once again be elected to serve the people of Indiana’s 7th Congressional District. Serving Hoosiers in Congress is the honor of my life and a responsibility I don’t take lightly. Regardless of the outcome in other races
I enjoyed my day visiting voting centers around indianapolis today! It was wonderful seeing so many people exercising their right to vote. Let’s bring it home now! https://t.co/ONiY4lQ5bZ
Make sure to get out and vote TODAY! #gotv #Election2020 https://t.co/dLTvBDeRtg
Happy Election Day! Polls are open from 6AM-6PM. You can vote at any vote center in Marion County. To find your closest visit https://t.co/QdYEJH6GPl https://t.co/tVLav4jQw4
Great news! Kudos to the Marion County Election Board for taking this big step to get Hoosiers to the polls. https://t.co/Ch4gxnXRhY
Join us in getting out the vote for Democrats up and down the ballot! No experience needed. Training provided. Sign up to help in the following link.  https://t.co/6tOw6phMdX https://t.co/XKjdU2hzHR
I am working hard to improve Hoosier's healthcare! Make sure to remember Carson when you cast your ballot this election. https://t.co/1J27N9hgBS

I am proud to be a co-sponsor of H.R. 7120 the George Floyd Justice in Policing Act which passed the House of Representatives in June of this year. This bill will increase transparency in law enforcement and end racial profiling. https://t.co/i7TdlIrlMl
Vote for Carson this Election! https://t.co/XkDk30MgUQ

A new debate but more of the same from Pres. Trump — lies anger division & baseless attacks. Americans want to hear about solutions to the crises were facing and @JoeBiden was the only candidate on that stage who delivered. Our choice is clearer than ever. #BidenHarris2020
Today is the last day to submit an absentee ballot application! Go to https://t.co/G16jK49Pxj to submit your online application! You have until 11:59PM TONIGHT! https://t.co/rcRq9KvvdL
Looking toward the future!! Let’s use our voices and VOTE!! https://t.co/N6ryJLPEfI
Sign up to get your Congressman Carson yard sign here! https://t.co/zTWkpKFxAW https://t.co/Zj4peVnabj

During the pandemic I have been working to ensure we can get through this crisis. I supported #CARESAct – which created $260 billion in unemployment benefits. Recently I voted to pass the #HeroesAct – restoring the $1200 check. The Repulican-controlled Senate needs to act now.
Sign up to get your Congressman Carson yard sign here! https://t.co/zTWkpKFxAW https://t.co/a0gjg6iv5N

.@KamalaHarris did an excellent job in tonight’s #VPDebate showing yet again why our country needs #BidenHarris. The plexiglass divider also served as another stark reminder that this President has failed to keep Americans safe from #COVID19 — even his own staff.

This month we observe #NationalBullyingPreventionMonth. I’ve sponsored bills that aim to prohibit and prevent bullying and harassment in schools like the Safe Schools Improvement Act of 2019 and the H. Con. Res. 98 – which brings attention to harassment to LGBTQ+ members. https://t.co/FJJiD2VTKJ
Early voting starts today! Visit https://t.co/O19nzLXUiq to find out the hours and locations! https://t.co/IsrtDsOSFn
Voter Registration ends today! Make sure you visit https://t.co/klFRBIsWbQ to check your registration status and make sure you're all set to vote this election! https://t.co/4ToMoqCNwk

Today I was able to attend the Pop Up and Vote event. I was thrilled to see all the excitement and motivation to vote in this year’s election. Make sure you register to vote by this Monday October 5th! #registertovote #VoteDemocrat https://t.co/2S3tlfjrOI

This month is #DomesticViolenceAwarenessMonth. As a former law enforcement officer I’ve witnessed the impact of domestic violence. In Congress it's my duty to protect the most vulnerable. I'll continue to support programs like VAWA – providing protection to victims. https://t.co/GHetZYblJt
Early voting begins next week! Make your plan to vote now! For more information visit https://t.co/O19nzMfv9Y https://t.co/5uDKHBMqDn

Tonight’s debate clearly showed the choice we must make in this election: Hope or fear truth or lies and even life or death. If you’re fired up do something about it! Register to vote and help others do the same. #BidenHarris2020 #2020Debates https://t.co/Sn0Ee39s6d

On #BiVisibilityDay we celebrate the Bisexual Community and we also recognize the stigma around this community and how it's affected by it. To all my bisexual friends we see you and you matter. I will continue to fight hard for LGBTQ protections in the House! https://t.co/9htvW6d6fe
Don’t wait register to vote TODAY! Go to https://t.co/nhPeMwBfrC. Have you moved recently? Update your voter registration here too! https://t.co/3ogT3EhB7Y

Today we celebrate #ConstitutionDay. The Constitution is a living document that sets the framework of our government and the rights and freedoms we enjoy today. Let’s honor the Constitution by participating in our democracy and exercising our right to vote this November 3rd!

Can you believe we are only 50 days away from the most important Election of our lifetimes? How are you going to help get Democrats elected this fall? Join Team Carson today! https://t.co/96ASk4Ot2b https://t.co/9iSGAASbJA

This time last year we were enjoying a beautiful fall day walking and greeting neighbors at the Riverside Parade. I wish we could all celebrate the day together as usual but I know next year the neighborhood celebration will be bigger and better than ever. https://t.co/1MjjyUHKkm
https://t.co/whSUF6nBDn

This year’s #RNC reflected the toxicity of the Trump Administration. It was divisive wildly out of touch and reveled in its embrace of corruption. We cannot afford one more moment let alone four more years of this chaos. We need a new direction.

It’s Race Day! This day is always filled with fun and excitement for our great city of Indianapolis and the entire country. Even though this year looks quite a bit different than it usually does we will still enjoy it! Drivers start your engines! https://t.co/FuY7FA9gbZ

Thank you @JoeBiden for reminding us what character compassion and leadership look like. I have no doubt you and @KamalaHarris are the leaders Americans need at this critical moment. I’m more excited than ever to cast my ballot for these amazing public servants! #BidenHarris2020
Don’t wait register to vote TODAY! Go to https://t.co/nhPeMwBfrC. Have you moved recently? Update your voter registration here too! https://t.co/RiDSstWez2

My friend @KamalaHarris is a fighter for equality. She’s incredibly smart tough as nails and also has a heart big enough to truly understand the crises Americans are facing. She’ll make an excellent #VicePresident and I commend @JoeBiden for making a wise and historic choice.
The Election is 90 Days Away What will you do to help Democrats win in this election? Join Team Carson today to volunteer and make a difference! https://t.co/6Yo2gBEsUY https://t.co/9tym0yxzpX

Today we remember and honor those who were wounded on the battlefield or paid the ultimate sacrifice with their lives. On #PurpleHeartDay thank you for your bravery courage and sacrifice. https://t.co/alhzpAR2py

#OTD in 1965 the #VotingRightsAct became law. This year I'm particularly grateful to my dear friend and colleague Rep. #JohnLewis for fighting for its passage. We must honor him and restore the strength of the law by passing the John Lewis #VotingRights Advancement Act. https://t.co/XybVFX3SbQ

This time last year we came together in support of fellow Democrats and shared laughs and good food. I am hopeful next year Democrats will be able to gather at the annual @MCDPIndy Picnic. Until then everyone please keep wearing your mask and practicing social distancing. https://t.co/91n9Z9Fzes

Happy Birthday President @BarackObama! Thank you for your leadership and for always being a guiding voice. I hope your day is filled with the love of family and friends.  Photo cred: Time Magazine https://t.co/42gMXkmaGI

President Trump has now suggested that the #2020Election be postponed. We cannot allow him to be elected again. I urge everyone to #VoteByMail or on November 3rd because we cannot have another four years of this. We need to vote him out of office! https://t.co/Plbbp3J0NP
This is the most important election of our lifetimes. Join Team Carson today to volunteer and make a difference! Sign up here: https://t.co/6Yo2gBEsUY https://t.co/8zmMKEiIil

#OTD we commemorate the 56th Anniversary of the #CivilRightsAct . This was a major turning point in our efforts to outlaw discrimination but there's still a long way to go. https://t.co/D2b0puOiHo
https://t.co/sJsRaRhT7I

On #Juneteenth we commemorate the end of slavery in Texas in 1865 when slaves there were notified of the Emancipation Proclamation. We need to use today & every day to continue to call for change because #BlackLivesMatter. I will continue to push for this change in Washington. https://t.co/LccLJWP9z6

Happy #Pride2020 to everyone in the LGBTQ+ community never stop being proud of who you are. There's still a long way to go but we won't stop fighting against bigotry and hatred. #loveislove https://t.co/kWKpuXeqRh

#OTD 57 years ago on June 10 1963 President John F. Kennedy signed the #EqualPayAct into law - this law mandates equal pay for equal work. The bill is one of the first laws aimed at reducing gender discrimination and the #wagegap in the workplace. https://t.co/0NDf5DaKRM
Today we celebrate those who have won the battle against cancer. You are an inspiration to all of us! #NationalCancerSurvivorDay https://t.co/ML1LI5wpiJ
Thank you to all the volunteers who joined our virtual phone bank today! Couldn't do this without you! #ElectionDay https://t.co/21CLql9bNf

Happy Election Day! You have until NOON to drop off your absentee ballots and until 6pm to vote in person! If voting in person make sure to practice social distancing. #Election2020 https://t.co/voasp6P6lh

#OTD we celebrate #WorldRedCrossDay - a day to remember the bravery of staff and volunteers providing services to the most vulnerable people in all different contexts. We are especially thankful for the Red Cross today during the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/cw9HAaZXHc

It’s #NationalNursesWeek we don’t always see the impact of their efforts. But today as they stand on the front lines they need our support more than ever. #ThankYouNurses for putting your own health at risk to protect us. Your commitment makes a lifesaving difference every day! https://t.co/5gj5YrMrNF

Due to the #COVID19 outbreak the #PrimaryElection has been moved to June 2. Deadline to register to vote has been moved to May 4. Please visit https://t.co/nhPeMwBfrC to register and to get more information on how to vote by mail.
Today is #CensusDay2020. Fill out the census at https://t.co/EjRG6TSHEn and make sure you are counted! It only takes a few minutes to complete. https://t.co/1RshKQYQ15

Today Gov. Holcomb announced a #stayathome order amid the #COVID19 effective from March 25th until April 7th. The state of Indiana has a total of 259 positive cases; the death toll is now at 7. It is essential that we follow the order and take the necessary precautions.

It was announced today that Indiana’s #PrimaryElection has been rescheduled for June 2nd. This is a preventative measure in response to the #COVID19 outbreak - a move that will provide Hoosiers safer access to the polls and everyone the ability to vote via absentee.
